item.title: 特朗普将对华关税提高至至少 54%，经济遭受重创
item.description: 美国对几乎所有中国产品加征了有史以来最大规模的关税，使征税总额至少达到 54%，此举可能会削弱中国对世界最大经济体的出货量。【原文：The US has hit China with the biggest-ever tariff hike on almost all Chinese products, bringing total levies to at least 54%, a move that could decimate Chinese shipments to the world’s largest economy.】

item.title: 特朗普围绕美国经济的关税墙意外偏高
item.description: 大于预期。如果要从美国总统唐纳德-特朗普周三宣布的关税声明中得到一个简单的启示，那就是："这是个大问题。【原文：Bigger than expected. If there is one simple takeaway from US President Donald Trump’s tariff announcement on Wednesday, that is it.】

item.title: 智囊团称：英国生活水平面临税收和账单带来的 400 英镑冲击
item.description: 决议基金会（Resolution Foundation）智囊团的分析发现，尽管最低工资标准的提高能够抑制通胀，但税收和账单的增加将使典型的英国家庭在下一财政年度的收入减少 400 英镑（约合 517 美元）。【原文：Higher taxes and bills will leave the typical UK household £400 ($517) worse off in the coming fiscal year despite an inflation-busting increase in the minimum wage, analysis by the Resolution Foundation think tank found.】

item.title: 帮助特穆和谢因的关税漏洞将于 5 月 2 日关闭
item.description: 白宫表示，目前允许来自中国和香港的价值高达800美元的包裹免税进入美国的微量关税豁免将于5月2日终止，这对Temu和Shein等折扣市场来说是一个潜在的打击。【原文：De minimis tariff exemptions, which currently allow packages worth as much as $800 from China and Hong Kong to enter the US duty free, will end on May 2, the White House said, a potential blow to discount marketplaces like Temu and Shein.】

item.title: 特朗普关税刺激避险买盘，日元表现优于主要同行
item.description: 在唐纳德-特朗普总统宣布加征关税提振避险需求后，日元兑美元在所有主要货币中表现最佳。【原文：The yen is the best performer among all of its major peers against the dollar after President Donald Trump’s tariffs announcement boosted haven demand.】

item.title: 特朗普关税影响金属需求，美国铜价下滑
item.description: 美国总统唐纳德-特朗普对美国在全球的贸易伙伴征收关税，此举标志着他的贸易战大幅升级，周四亚洲早盘纽约铜价下滑。【原文：Copper in New York slid in the Asian morning on Thursday after US President Donald Trump imposed tariffs on US trading partners worldwide, a move that marks a significant escalation in his trade war.】

item.title: 特朗普关税引发全球增长风险，恐惧笼罩市场
item.description: 有那么一瞬间，华尔街对唐纳德-特朗普总统关税计划的最坏担心似乎是多余的，市场开始出现缓解性反弹。【原文：For a brief moment it looked like Wall Street’s worst fears about President Donald Trump’s tariff plans were misplaced — and a relief rally started racing through markets.】

item.title: 特朗普宣布对等关税，对大宗商品影响不一
item.description: 期待已久的唐纳德-特朗普总统宣布对进口美国的商品征收全面的对等关税，这引发了油价暴跌，而黄金上涨。【原文：The long—awaited unveiling by President Donald Trump of sweeping reciprocal tariffs on imports into the US triggered a slump in oil prices while gold rose.】

item.title: 亚洲资产因美国提高关税而受到冲击
item.description: 据策略师称，美国总统唐纳德-特朗普的关税大棒首当其冲，亚洲经济体的货币和股票预计将面临抛售压力。【原文：Asian economies bore the brunt of US President Donald Trump’s tariff deluge, with their currencies and stocks expected to come under selling pressure, according to strategists.】

item.title: 特朗普宣布征收关税，日本股市期货下跌，日元升值
item.description: 在美国总统唐纳德-特朗普对全球贸易伙伴征收 24% 的关税后，日本股票期货大幅下跌。日元走强也可能拖累出口商股价走低。【原文：Japan’s stock futures slumped after President Donald Trump slapped the nation with a 24% levy as part of tariffs on trading partners worldwide. A stronger yen may also drag exporter shares lower.】

item.title: 以下是特朗普对各国征收的互惠关税
item.description: 以下是美国总统唐纳德-特朗普在 4 月 2 日新闻发布会上宣布的部分互惠关税清单。【原文：The following is a partial list of reciprocal tariffs announced by US President Donald Trump during his April 2 press conference.】

item.title: 研究称，洛杉矶的豪宅税压低了多户住宅和税收
item.description: 加州大学洛杉矶分校的研究人员指出，洛杉矶市的住房建设和税收收入正受到选民批准的高价房产销售税的影响。【原文：Housing construction and tax revenue in the city of Los Angeles are being hurt by a voter-approved levy on high-priced property sales, according to researchers at the University of California at Los Angeles.】

item.title: 特朗普颠覆全球贸易秩序，美国 500 指数期货暴跌
item.description: 在美国总统唐纳德-特朗普概述了一系列对美贸易征收关税的措施后，美国股指期货暴跌近 4%，这增加了全面贸易战的可能性，可能使美国经济陷入衰退。【原文：US stock futures plunged almost 4% after President Donald Trump outlined a slate of tariffs on US trading that raises the likelihood of a full-blown trade war that could plunge the US economy into a recession.】

item.title: 特朗普大范围关税威胁需求，石油价格下跌
item.description: 美国总统唐纳德-特朗普（Donald Trump）对包括中国和欧盟在内的主要贸易伙伴征收严厉的关税，加剧了威胁全球需求的贸易战，石油随之下跌。【原文：Oil fell after US President Donald Trump rolled out stiff tariffs on major trading partners, including China and the European Union, ratcheting up a trade war that threatens global demand.】

item.title: 中国市场回暖，信用分析师转行增多
item.description: 随着中国债券交易和回报率的回升，亚洲卖方信贷分析师之间开始了一场音乐椅游戏。【原文：A game of musical chairs has started among sell-side credit analysts in Asia amid a pickup in Chinese bond deals and returns.】

item.title: 澳大利亚总理称美国征收 10%关税是 "糟糕的决定"，不会做出回应
item.description: 澳大利亚总理安东尼-阿尔巴内塞将美国宣布对澳大利亚商品征收 10%的关税描述为 "糟糕的决定"，同时表示不会以对等征税作为回应。【原文：Prime Minister Anthony Albanese described the US announcement of a 10% tariff on Australian goods as a “poor decision,” while saying that he will not respond with reciprocal levies.】

item.title: 特朗普征收 10%关税后，英国为达成协议保持干劲
item.description: 在美国总统唐纳德-特朗普对所有从英国进口的商品征收 10%的关税，并将其称为英国的 "解放日 "之后，英国没有采取报复行动，并表示将继续推动与美国达成贸易协议。【原文：The UK refrained from retaliation and said it would maintain its push for a US trade deal after President Donald Trump slapped tariffs of 10% on all imports from Britain as part of a wider global package which he dubbed “Liberation Day” for his country.】

item.title: 特朗普关税对世界市场意味着什么？
item.description: 唐纳德-特朗普（Donald Trump）在 "解放日 "的高潮中威胁要破坏现代交易秩序，这让华尔街的交易员们感到震惊。【原文：Wall Street traders were left reeling after Donald Trump made good on his threat to disrupt the modern trading order at the climax of ‘Liberation Day.’】

item.title: 美国将钢铁、铝、铜和黄金排除在互惠关税之外
item.description: 白宫表示，进口钢铁和铝不会被征收对等关税，此举至少可以减轻国内买家的负担，因为他们已经对从汽车到洗碗机等各种产品中使用的所有进口关键金属征收 25% 的关税。【原文：The White House said steel and aluminum imports won’t be subject to reciprocal tariffs in a move that will provide at least some relief to domestic buyers already incurring 25% duties on all imports of the key metals used in everything from automobiles to dishwashers.】

item.title: 贝森特敦促不要采取报复行动，并表示对会谈 "拭目以待
item.description: 美国财政部长斯科特-贝森特（Scott Bessent）敦促美国贸易伙伴不要对唐纳德-特朗普总统新征收的一系列报复性关税采取报复措施。【原文：Treasury Secretary Scott Bessent urged US trading partners against taking retaliatory steps against President Donald Trump’s new set of retaliatory tariffs.】

item.title: 特朗普贸易战引发对原油需求的担忧，原油下跌
item.description: 在美国总统唐纳德-特朗普加大贸易战力度，对主要贸易伙伴全面征收关税之后，原油出现回落，引发了人们对经济动荡将损害原油需求的担忧。【原文：Oil retreated after US President Donald Trump ratcheted up his trade war with sweeping tariffs on major trading partners, raising concerns that economic turmoil will hurt crude demand.】

item.title: 甲骨文公司告知客户最近第二次遭到黑客攻击，登录数据被盗
item.description: 据两位熟悉此事的人士透露，甲骨文公司已告知客户，一名黑客侵入了一个计算机系统，并盗取了客户的旧登录凭证。这是这家软件公司上个月向客户承认的第二起网络安全漏洞事件。【原文：Oracle Corp. has told customers that a hacker broke into a computer system and stole old client log-in credentials, according to two people familiar with the matter. It’s the second cybersecurity breach that the software company has acknowledged to clients in the last month.】

item.title: SMBC 与富士通合作开发人工智能预测服务
item.description: 三井住友银行（Sumitomo Mitsui Banking Corp.）正在利用富士通公司（Fujitsu Ltd.）的人工智能模型来加强其为应对工资和材料成本上涨的客户提供的咨询服务。【原文：Sumitomo Mitsui Banking Corp. is tapping Fujitsu Ltd.’s artificial intelligence models to bolster its advisory services for customers grappling with rising wages and materials costs.】

item.title: 芝加哥因云税和房屋销售收入超预期
item.description: 今年前两个月，芝加哥的财政收入超出预期 7.2%，这要归功于对云存储和房屋销售征收的税款，这些税款的征收将帮助这个正为年度赤字而苦苦挣扎的城市。【原文：Chicago’s revenue exceeded estimates by 7.2% in the first two months of this year thanks to taxes on cloud storage and home sales, collections that will help a city that’s struggling with annual deficits.】

item.title: Scale AI 预计 2025 年销售额将翻一番多，达到 20 亿美元
item.description:
初创公司去年创造了约 8.7 亿美元的收入。【原文：

Startup generated revenue of about $870 million last year.

】

item.title: 丹麦马士基不顾特朗普威胁购买巴拿马运河铁路
item.description: 丹麦航运巨头 A.P. Moller-Maersk A/S 收购了一条连接巴拿马运河两端港口的铁路，削弱了美国在这条关键贸易路线上的存在，而唐纳德-特朗普正试图在这条路线上赶走竞争对手。【原文：Danish shipping powerhouse A.P. Moller-Maersk A/S purchased a railway linking ports at both ends of the Panama Canal, undermining the US’s presence along a key trade route where Donald Trump is trying to elbow out competitors.】

item.title: 关税威胁冲击生产中心后苹果股价下滑
item.description: 美国总统唐纳德-特朗普（Donald Trump）宣布对苹果公司的海外生产中心征收关税后，苹果公司在尾盘交易中下滑达 5.6%，这可能使这家 iPhone 制造商比预期更容易受到关税的影响。【原文：Apple Inc. slid as much as 5.6% in late trading after President Donald Trump announced tariffs that target its overseas production hubs, potentially making the iPhone maker more vulnerable to the levies than anticipated.】

item.title: 不列颠哥伦比亚省四年来第四次被下调信用评级
item.description: 不列颠哥伦比亚省的信用评级被 S&P 全球评级公司下调至 A+，原因是在政府支出增加的同时，移民减少和贸易不确定性对加拿大该省的经济增长造成了压力。【原文：British Columbia’s credit rating has been cut to A+ by S&P Global Ratings as lower immigration and trade uncertainty weigh on the Canadian province’s economic growth at the same time that governmental spending is increasing.】

item.title: 特朗普宣布加征关税提振避险需求，黄金上涨
item.description: 唐纳德-特朗普的对等关税刺激了避险需求，现货黄金走高。【原文：Spot gold advanced as Donald Trump’s reciprocal tariffs boost haven demand.】

item.title: Neuralink 面向全球招募脑植入研究人员
item.description: 埃隆-马斯克（Elon Musk）的大脑植入公司 Neuralink 正在寻找世界各地的病人参与一种设备的研究，这种设备可以让人们用意念控制计算机。【原文：Neuralink, Elon Musk’s brain implant company, is looking for patients all over the world to participate in research on a device that allows people to use their thoughts to control computers.】
